body:
$! You must tell DVLA if you have an atrial or ventricular defibrillator. $!

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DEFIB1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D

[Download 'DEFIB1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 232KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065607.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}

$D


##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D

[Download 'VOCH1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 394KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065302.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}

$D

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have an atrial or ventricular defibrillator - download the correct form to let them know
title: Atrial and ventricular defibrillators and driving
